title: China's slowdown shows world cannot rely on Beijing bailouts any more
text:
China’s economic growth has slowed to its weakest in decades, and the rest of the world should be worried.

Annual GDP rose by 6pc in the third quarter, a disappointing fall from 6.2pc in the second, just scraping through to match the official target. It is set to fall below 6pc next year. Manufacturing is in trouble and the trade war is biting.

Growth of 6pc does not sound bad by rich-world standards. It is twice the IMF’s predicted growth rate for the entire world this year. And it is four times the growth rate of the eurozone and UK.

Nonetheless, alarm bells should be sounding.

China has been a key prop to world growth for the past 20 years. As recently as 2011 its growth rate exceeded 10pc....
description: China’s economic growth has slowed to its weakest in decades, and the rest of the world should be worried.
